intro: Dalechampia variifolia, commonly known as the variable dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that vary in shape and size across different parts of the plant. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Dalechampia variifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique floral structure.
